page.title: 08Old Buildings
page.content: Across the road from the old Roebuck Inn is a house called the Old Smiffy which used to be a place where an old lady or man made shoes.In Shephalbury Park is an old manor, now a boarding school for boys. St.Marys church is the oldest church in our part of Stevenage and is about one thousand years old. There are many churches in Stevenage, but none as old as St.Marys,except St.Nicholas.The Red Lion pub is being renovated because it is falling down. It is hundreds of years old.When the people started to build St.Marys they stayed in the pub with their families. In Fairlands Valley there is a house which is very old that used to be a farm house.
